docs.snippet: Wilmer Flores’s strong performances thus far have piqued the Mets’ interest enough to see what his real abilities — and limitations — might be....
docs.lead_paragraph: Wilmer Flores’s strong performances thus far have piqued the Mets’ interest enough to see what his real abilities — and limitations — might be.
docs.abstract: New York Mets prospect Wilmer Flores, who was called up to play third base in place of David Wright, who injured his hamstring, has been solid on the field and at the plate; after going hitless during his first game, Flores drove in nine runs over his next five games, getting at least one RBI each night.

headline.main: To Keep Flores’s Bat in Lineup, Mets Plan to Move Him Around the Infield
headline.print_headline: To Keep Flores’s Bat in Lineup, Mets Plan to Move Him Around the Infield

docs.snippet: Ike Davis, who was demoted in June to find his swing, is leading the majors in August with a .706 on-base percentage, but his power has been absent....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ike Davis, who was demoted in June to find his swing, is leading the majors in August with a .706 on-base percentage, but his power has been absent.
docs.abstract: Benjamin Hoffman Keeping Score column on New York Mets first baseman Ike Davis, whose on-base percentage has increased 80 points, to .325 from .242, with only one home run; says although his recent hot streak may be a mirage, team must be happy to have anything positive to say about Davis, who was demoted to Class AA Las Vegas at the beginning of the season.

headline.main: Getting on Base a Lot Helps a Team Only So Much
headline.print_headline: Getting on Base a Lot Helps a Team Only So Much
